isis.stitle: CAB: 7300, 7400, 7500, 7600, 7700, 8500 AND 8600 MODELS - INSTALL - ELECTRIC WINDSHIELD WIPER MOTOR

svcsubproc.title: Install Electric Windshield Wiper Motor on Standard Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500, 7600, 7700, 8500 and 8600 Models, Extended Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500, 7600, 8500 and 8600 Models and Crew Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500 and 7600 Models
svcsubproc.para: The windshield wiper system consists of a single unitized 12 volt electric motor that operates the wiper arms through linkage (Figure 122) .
Since the wiper motor is of unitized construction, there is no need for motor rebuild or adjustments. There are no serviceable parts; the complete assembly is replaced.

caution.para: Do not attempt to move the blades through their sweep by grasping the wiper arm. This action may result in the teeth being broken off the drive gear or the linkage bent. If blades are frozen to windshield, do not operate control switch until they have been freed.

note.para: Windshield wipers and cowl tray have been removed in part of Figure 122 to show the windshield wiper assembly located under the cowl tray.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 122 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Position electric wiper motor (Item 3, view arrow A) in place on the wiper motor mounting bracket (Item 6, view arrow A). Install three hex flanged bolts (Item 7, view arrow A) securing electric wiper motor to the wiper motor mounting bracket. Tighten to 44.3 to 62 Lbf-in (5 to 7 N•m).

Position wiper drive arm (Item 2, view arrow A) and lock washer (Item 4, view arrow A) onto electric wiper motor shaft. Install hex retaining nut (Item 1, view arrow A and view arrow B) securing wiper drive arm (Item 2, view arrow A) to electric wiper motor (Item 3, view arrow A). Tighten to 104 to 140 Lbf-in (11.8 to 15.8 N•m).

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 121 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: If required, position wiring harness (Item 13, view arrow A) at windshield wiper motor (Item 6) and/or windshield wiper motor mounting bracket (Item 4) and secure with ty-wrap (Item 12, view arrow A).
Connect wiring harness connector (Item 1) to windshield wiper motor connector (Item 2).
With ignition key in ON position, cycle wiper arm to the end of the sweep cycle (wiper blade by left side of windshield). Turn key to OFF position.
Lower tilt hood to closed position and latch hood on both sides.
Turn wipers on to high speed and activate windshield washer to check for proper operation. Adjust position of windshield wiper arm and blade assembly if required to obtain proper wiper operation.
